title: Lean Business Process Management Change Skills
headline: This free online course will show you how to go from wasting valuable time and resources to improving productivity.
description: If you have ever wondered how you can make a meaningful difference to the efficiency in your organization, then this free online course is a great place to start. Learn how to measure, manage and eliminate the waste lurking in teams or business processes with a practical method of improvement. This LEAN business management course will show you how you can reduce the non-value business activities and set SMART goals for your business.
courseDescription:
Lean Business Process Management Change Skills is a free online course that aims to provide you with an in-depth understanding of how to manage the waste lurking in a team or business processes. It is important to understand the simple and practical continuous improvement process to move your team or business from wasting valuable resources to improving efficiency and productivity. You will learn how to improve processes with the important lean tools and techniques as well as learning the concepts of value, waste and the important lean improvement projects that can be utilized. This business management course introduces you to the features of some simple improvement processes, the features “TIM WOODS” guidelines and how to analyze the process flow of events in your organization or business segment.

Some of the tools you will be taught how to use are how to carry out a root cause analysis, a fishbone diagram breakdown, the “5WHYs”, and how to create a process map. You will then move on to analyzing cause and effects, the materials that contribute to the effects and other contributing factors of the root cause. Do you know that there are specific techniques that can help you set achievable goals in your business process? The process management course describes how to measure the set goals, determine a realistic goal and how a business can be set up to close some gaps with the use of the SMED principle. Next you will learn how to write and implement SMART goals, before delving into the steps needed to carry out a changeover action in an organization including how to measure the productive and non-productive time in the business. The following key theme takes you through the idea generation process, brainstorming stage, and how to formulate business improvement questions along with how to execute, monitor and coordinate the tools, dashboard and other key properties that can be used in a project. Sometimes there will be resistance from colleagues about a new course of action and this business management training will teach you how to validate why you are moving away from something, analyze what you are moving towards and the reactions that changed the way you view the business.

Anyone interested in change management, lean business principles, SMART goals or business management would gain invaluable knowledge from this free online course. Enrolling in this course could also be of great benefit to you if there are some project management or business analysis in your current role and you would like to refine your skills and make an even bigger contribution to your organization.

Start Course Now

  • Lesson Summary 
    • To survive and thrive, your business needs to be competitive, offer great service, deliver the quality your customers expect and it has to be profitable.  Waste is the enemy of competitiveness, service and quality. 
    • Many businesses are using lean techniques to reduce waste in all its forms. Lean is a way of thinking about problems as it is about a war between value and waste. Value is anything that the customer is willing to pay for, either services or goods, anything activities or business that help the customers get the satisfaction they require is what we call value-adding activity.
    • Waste is anything you are doing within the business that is not contributing to adding value, the non-value activities are called waste. There are simple improvement processes that can be used such as:
      - Reason why
      - Current state analysis
      - Define goal
      - Identify action and plan
      - Implementation 
      - Review.
    • The current state is basically the way of understanding what is happening when it's happening, as well as how it is happening. This can be done with a process flow to avoid making assumptions. Some tools can be used to create a process flow such as Collection of Data, taking measures, analyses measuring frequency and percentages. 
    • To implement all the techniques, you have to carefully, control and monitor with the Gantt chart. You can use meetings, dashboard, as well as reports to effectively monitor performances. 
  • Learning Outcomes 
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the purpose for the improvement of the business process.
    • Identify the high-level business objective that we are trying to reach. 
    • Explain how to tie a business to high-level business objectives. 
    • Identify the business driver, as well as the business mission stage. 
    • Discuss how to validate the reason for doing something and the motivation for doing it.

  • Lesson Summary 
    • The first thing we have to ask before going into process change is finding the reason, what is the high-level business objective we are trying t reach? what is the business mission statement?
    • One of the things we need to understand is the business mission and the stage of development of the business. 
    • The business stage must be defined as either its in the business launch, repositioning or finding a new niche, increasing market share, increasing profitability, replication or diversification stage. 
    • It is important to have a brainstorming session where we share the activities that can be done, for example, we could innovate our product for a competitive advantage, increase our market reach and focus, as well as offering better employee benefits and attract better employees. 
    • We need to validate the reason why we are doing something, why we are moving away from something, why we are moving into another, is this a knee jerk reaction or is it a long term plan, these are questions that should be asking when validating the reasons. 
    • We need to define our goals by creating SMART goals, that must be specific, measurable, achievable, relevant and time-bound. The SMART goal is a guide that is important in setting a goal.
    • To implement your plans, you have to implement the project control which comprises of the following:
      - Tasklist
      - Issues list
      - Announcements
      - Regular meetings 
      - Gantt charts. 
    • After implementing the project control, it is important to analyse the success, review the stages at the end of the and create a mind map.
